intro: Porrum schoenoprasum, commonly known as chervil, is a delicate annual herb native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its aromatic leaves are often used in culinary applications, particularly in French cuisine. Due to its short growing season, it is typically harvested early in the spring.
